name: Airplane Mode: An Irreverent History of Travel - Book Signing
description:
Join us for a book signing session with author Shahnaz Habib, whose book Airplane Mode has been longlisted for the Andrew Carnegie Medals of Excellence!
This witty personal and cultural history of travel from the perspective of a Third World-raised woman of color, Airplane Mode, asks: what does it mean to be a joyous traveler when we live in the ruins of colonialism, capitalism and climate change?
The conditions of travel have long been dictated by the color of passports and the color of skin.
The color of one’s skin and passport have long dictated the conditions of travel.  For Shahnaz Habib, travel and travel writing have always been complicated pleasures. Habib threads the history of travel with her personal story as a child on family vacations in India, an adult curious about the world, and an immigrant for whom roundtrips are an annual fact of life. Tracing the power dynamics that underlie tourism, this insightful debut parses who gets to travel, and who gets to write about the experience.
Threaded through the book are inviting and playful analyses of obvious and not-so-obvious travel artifacts: passports, carousels, bougainvilleas, guidebooks, trains, the idea of wanderlust itself. Together, they tell a subversive history of travel as a Euro-American mode of consumerism—but as any traveler knows, travel is more than that. As an immigrant whose loved ones live across continents, Habib takes a deeply curious and joyful look at a troubled and beloved activity.

name: Troo in Bengaluru! - A Weekend of Creativity, Curiosity and Connection for Families
description:
Troo in Bengaluru: A Weekend of Creativity, Curiosity, and Connection for Families
Troo, the new digital playful companion and learning coach for children, brought to you by Yeti, My Friend. Yeti My Friend is making its grand community launch in Bengaluru with a unique family-focused event. Hosted at the popular Atta Galatta bookstore on February 18th and 19th, the event promises an unforgettable weekend filled with creativity, curiosity, and connection for parents and kids alike.
Yeti, My Friend is a creative learning platform designed to spark curiosity and nurture creativity in children through engaging activities, stories, and screen-free experiences in its award-winning educational app for children aged 4-9.
This immersive two-day event will feature four interactive sessions (two hours each) tailored to engage children and parents. Kids can look forward to hands-on activities that will spark their curiosity and creativity, inspired by the magical world of Troo and captivating storytelling sessions led by Lavanya Prasad (Founder of Talescope) and Charulatha C, Author of the best-selling Beaming Child series.
Parents can participate in thought-provoking round-table discussions, parenting talks, and interactive activities that foster community and share valuable insights into modern parenting.
"Troo's mission has always been to nurture curiosity and creativity in children while offering parents tools and a supportive community to navigate their parenting journey," said Sudha Shankar, CEO & Founder of Yeti, My Friend. "This event brings that mission to life through a screen-free, enriching experience for families."

name: 1000 Days of Love - Weekly Book Reading Sessions
description:
What is it? TDOL Secret Sessions is a one-of-a-kind event series to give you a front-row seat to the upcoming novel, 1000 Days of Love. In each session, the author will read two chapters and get your feedback in real time, while you get to meet like-minded people and build lifelong connections. 
Who is doing it? This event is hosted by the novel's author, Soundarya Balasubramani. She's a 2x author, founder of an American startup, renowned speaker, and influencer. Find her on LinkedIn and Instagram.
Why? Products have "launches" where they get user feedback to iterate and improve. Why not a book too? 
When? Ten sessions are hosted beginning January 11th, 2025 - February 9th, 2025, every Saturday and Sunday afternoon.
Where?  Atta Galatta- The Bookstore (178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038)
We're only choosing 25 people per session. Spots are limited. Please apply below and we'll be in touch :) Let's create some magic together ✨
***DETAILS***
📅 Sessions: Every Saturday and Sunday at 2 PM IST, starting January 11, 2025
🕒 Duration: 90 minutes
📍 Location: Atta Galatta - The Bookstore, Bangalore, India
🎟️ Cost: Free of cost + Free food and refreshments + Incentives (Receive a free copy of the book when you attend 2 or more sessions, and earn an exclusive TDOL T-shirt 👕 by joining 5 or more sessions! 😊✨)

name: A Whole New World! - Movie Screening and Interaction
description:
On this evening, we invite you to join us for a screening of the cinematic adaptation of Timothee de Fombelle’s Toby Lolness, that has been made into a mini-series, followed by a conversation with children’s author Bijal Vachharajani on the alchemical magic that goes into creating new worlds in literature. This event will for those aged 10 and above!
Toby Alone and its sequel Toby and the Secrets of the Tree tell the story of a boy a millimeter and a half tall who lives in an oak tree and must save it from destruction. With a deft hand at describing climate change, social discrimination, extractivism and capitalist violence, themes usually explored in the adult world, de Fombelle brings to life all the horrors of the world we live in, in a bewitchingly charming world of childhood fantasy. Clever, challenging and true, Toby’s adventures craft a path for children to form their own journey into bravery and for things worth fighting for.
In this event, we hope to watch two episodes of the gorgeously hand-drawn animated series Toby Lolness following which we will have a discussion between Timothee de Fombelle and Bijal Vachharajani on the tools of their craft in creating a rich and vibrant new world. For children who are interested in growing up to be writers, and for adults who want to remember what it is like to be children while they write, this event will explore questions like: how much of the real world needs to be part of the worlds we create? What kind of stories do children like, the ones where they are safe, or the ones which show them the nature of the world and their place in it? And what’s the most evil character you can ever imagine, and how do you imagine him into existence?
Timothee de Fombelle was born in the heart of Paris in 1973, but often accompanied his architect father on his travels to Africa. Each summer his family left for the countryside (the west of France), where the five brothers and sisters lived like wild horses, making huts in the trees, playing in the river and losing themselves in the woods. In the evening they performed plays for their parents and devoured the books in the library. Childhood remains for him the lost paradise which he re-discovers through writing.
In 2006, he made his debut as an author with Toby Alone, a young adult novel published by Gallimard Jeunesse. The novel met with great success and has been translated into 29 languages. It has received 20 awards, including the English Marsh Award for Children's Literature in Translation, the Italian Andersen Award, and most French awards for children's literature. The movie rights were bought by Amber Entertainment (UK, United States).
We hope to see you all at 6.30 pm on February 1 at Atta Galata in Indiranagar, Bangalore for this event marking the inauguration of the Pardon my French! corner, followed by high tea and snacks!

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Chapter Carnival - Library Meetup
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View On Books, A Novel Club cordially invite you to the latest Library Meetup in town.
Join us for a innovative Library Meet wherein there`s over hundreds of books and you could pick a book in random and start reading together.
Have an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Come along with Empty Minds and fill it with rich literature from Atta Galatta’s Reading Section.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Reading minimum one chapter from a random book that you choose from the libary.
Participating in the ensuing curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: My Book of Alphabites - Book Reading
description:
Join author-illustrator Alankrita Amaya for the launch of her one-of-a-kind accordion-folding book, My Book of Alphabites, published by Batani Books. Enjoy an afternoon filled with storytelling and a fun mini accordion book-making craft, followed by a book signing at your favorite bookstore!
While you’re there, explore Batani’s other offerings, including the popular touch-and-feel book My Divine Friends, the beautifully illustrated picture book My Amma’s White Stone Mookuthi, and the engaging cooperative board game Little Butter Thieves, perfect for children aged 4 and up.
Website - https://www.batanikids.com/

name: Allegory of the Crab - Book Launch
description:
Discover Resilience and Healing Through Nature at the Launch of book “Allegory of the Crab” 
Acclaimed mental wellness coach, psychologist, and author Geetha Solaraj is proud to announce the launch of her debut book, “Allegory of the Crab” - Resilient Currents, Life Lessons from the Crab’s Journey. This deeply personal and inspirational book explores themes of resilience, healing, and growth, using powerful allegories from nature to shed light on life’s challenges.
Drawing from her own battle with cancer and her experiences as a counselling psychologist, Geetha Solaraj weaves together reflections, anecdotes, and poetic expressions to offer readers a guide to navigating life’s storms. The book connects the journey of the crab—an emblem of adaptability and strength—to our own lives, reminding us that we too have the capacity to rebuild, grow, and thrive no matter what challenges we face.
Key Highlights of the Book:

Nature as a Teacher: Explore how lessons from nature and the animal kingdom, particularly the crab, can inspire us to adapt, evolve, and overcome.
The Power of the Mind-Body Connection: Insights into understanding how our physical health often mirrors unresolved emotional and psychological conflicts.
Personalized Healing Journeys: Encouragement to discover and embrace unique paths to healing, recognizing that no two journeys are alike.
Poetry for the Soul: Heartfelt poems penned during Geetha’s most challenging times, offering comfort and hope to readers.

“As someone who has faced a life-altering illness, I’ve come to realize that resilience is not just about enduring hardships but also about adapting and finding strength in unexpected places,” says Geetha Solaraj. “This book is my attempt to share those lessons and inspire others to look within, listen to their bodies, and embrace their unique journeys toward healing.”
A Message of Hope and Resilience
Resilient Currents is more than just a book—it’s a reflection of the human spirit and its incredible ability to thrive despite adversity. Geetha’s heartfelt storytelling and profound insights make this book a valuable resource for anyone navigating life’s challenges, whether it’s a health crisis, personal transformation, or emotional upheaval.
About the Author
Geetha Solaraj is an Master NLP Mental Wellness coach and Counselling Psychologist specializing in stress reduction, communication improvement, and support for those battling cancer or caregiving. Her own transformative journey—from being a cancer survivor to a guiding light for others—has shaped her unique perspective on resilience and healing. Through her writing and workshops, Geetha continues to inspire countless individuals to embrace their strength and live fulfilling lives.
Join the Journey
We invite readers to explore Resilient Currents and discover powerful lessons about life, healing, and the beauty of the human spirit. Whether you’re seeking inspiration, guidance, or a fresh perspective, this book is a testament to the resilience we all carry within ourselves.

name: Tumhaare Baare Mein - Theatre Performance
description:
This play focuses on modern relationships and the complexities and the dilemmas which come with it. It emphasises on the voids and the fantasies which come with the differences in partners and how current relationships need a therapy and social media validation to achieve a sense of completion.
Show times are as follows:
8th February:
4:00PM - 6:00PM
7:00PM - 9:00PM
9th February:
7:00PM - 9:00PM

name: Manga Mochas - Manga and Comics Fan Meet
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books, Novel Club cordially invite you to the unique Manga Mochas, fans meet for Comics & Manga readers.
Are you a Manga maven or a comic connoisseur? Have you ever wanted to share your passion, connect with like-minded enthusiasts, and debate the finer points of your favorite stories? Well, your wait is over!
Calling all voracious readers of Manga, comics, and graphic novels! Join us for an exhilarating in-person meet-up where you can express YOUR views, discuss your beloved series, and meet fellow aficionados!
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolising the conversation.
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza: Kick things off with a fun game and introduce yourself. Let`s warm up the crowd!
2. Manga Mochas: Step into the spotlight for 5-7 minutes and share your passion for your favorite Manga or comic. No slides, just pure enthusiasm!
INTERMISSION: Chill & Chat
3. Fun & Games: Prepare for laughs with another engaging game.
4. What’s Next? Discuss and vote on the next Manga, comic, or graphic novel we’ll dive into!
5. Special Surprise Activity: Stay tuned for an exciting twist!
6. Photo Op: Say "cheese" for our group picture!
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Your February Story - Playback Theatre Performance
description:
Your February Story (Playback Theatre by Threads and Tales/ Lahe Lahe Caravan) 🌸
After the fresh start to the year or the overwhelming pressure to start something new in January settles, What does February mean to you? Is it a season of love and connection, a time for self-discovery, or perhaps a memory of solitude, longing, or celebration? Join us for *`Your February Story`*, a Playback Theatre experience where your stories take center stage.
Through live, improvised performances, we’ll bring to life the many shades of February—moments of love, reflections on relationships, the coziness of winter, the joys/sorrows of being a shorter month or memories that this special month holds for you. Whether your February feels like a tender embrace or a quiet pause, this is a space for you to share, connect, and reflect and see us perform it back for you!
Threads and Tales is a Playback theatre group started by Lahe Lahe Caravan created to bring real life stories to life through theatre, music and movement
Artists for the show:
Actors: Shraddha M, Shruthi V, Divyanshi G, Siddharth C, Ananya
Musicians: Nikhil S, Arkapraba G
Facilitator/ Conductor: Mansee S
Don’t miss an evening of heartfelt stories, shared emotions, and the magic of storytelling!
performer:
Lahe Lahe Caravan, 
Threads and Tales,

name: Acupuncture Healing Energy Bootcamp - Wellness Workshop
description:
Join us for an eye-opening and heart-opening session of healing at Atta Galatta!
In this session you will:
Learn about the ancient Chinese system of healing known as Acupuncture
Understand how blocked and imbalanced energies in our bodies could lead to chronic physical and emotional ailments
Get personalized treatment to unblock and balance your energies (no needles involved)
Have an intense guided journalling and meditation session to uncover inner wounds and heal them
Get tips for a more balanced life
Ideal for those who suffer from recurring physical ailments, those who seek to break recurring unhealthy behavioural patterns, those seeking relief from stress and anxiety and for curious souls looking to understand their bodies and minds better.
Participants are requested to wear loose and comfortable clothing as we will be doing some light stretches during the session.
Please bring along a pen and a bottle of water.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
February Read: : The Flavours of Nationalism by Nandita Haksar
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: Find Your Voice - Theatre Performance
description:
The "Find Your Voice" workshop is a four-hour intensive designed to help stage artists and aspiring performers discover, refine, and enhance their vocal abilities. Voice is one of the most critical tools for a performer, and this workshop delves into the essential elements of posture, breathing, sound production, and projection to equip participants with techniques for delivering powerful and sustainable performances.
Key Sections of the Workshop
1. Foundations of Voice and Posture
Posture and Alignment
Warm-Up and Body Awareness
2. Breathing Techniques for Vocal Power
Understanding Breath Control
Practical Breathing Exercises
Breath and Movement Coordination
3. Unlocking Vocal Potential
Expanding Vocal Range
Articulation and Resonance
Vocal Health
4. Voice Projection and Emotional Expression
Projection Techniques
Expressing Emotion Through Voice

name: Poetic Brew - Poetry Meetup
description:
Gather, Poetic Souls, for an afternoon divine, where verses entwine and words intertwine. In this literary realm, hearts open wide, For a Poetry Meet, let passion be our guide.
Inviting all Poetry enthusiasts 📚 to an In-Person Meet where you can indulge in creative poetry writing and reading session. 
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza - Intro yourself & let`s play an interesting fun Game to break ice cubes.
2. Poet`s Spotlight: Write a poem based on an innovative prompt letting your thoughts engage.
<-- INTERMISSION: CHILL & CHAT -->
3. Recital Stage: Take center stage for 5-7 minutes, discuss the verse that`s touched your head. As you share your verse, let passion reign.
4. Verse of the Month & What Lies Ahead - Vote for the next Poetry Book to read.
5. Say Butter - Click that Snap button for a group picture.
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolising the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Women's Sound and Art Workshop - Wellness Workshop
description:
Great things happen when women connect.
Sound is the source of this entire creation.
Did you know that the sound of the musical notes have a profoundly positive impact on our chakras?
Whether you receive the sounds from sacred singing bowls meant for the purpose of healing or well-being, or you sing the notes yourself, they bring in a sense of balance.
As this balance fosters feelings of joy and peace, it can aid creative expression in many forms.
Painting is one such creative form that is closely associated with sound and music. The choice of colours, mood and theme, sensory and emotional experience while painting gets influenced by the presence of sound and music in the environment where art is taking place impacting the artistic process and the final creation.
Inspired by this, we have a similar collaboration with artists Shilpi, Ayuushi, Priyanka and Khusbu who aspire to hold a Sound & Art Workshop for women wishing to experience such intense joy and creativity on 8th March 2025, International Women’s Day.
It would be a treat to observe the participants flow with the sounds and express their art.
Take away:
Painting to add vibrancy to your room or your living. An ideal gift that you can make, gift and surprise anyone.
This is a wonderful opportunity to receive encouragement from peer women.
What to Bring:

Yoga mat.
Shawl / stole.
Drinking water bottle.

No prior art experience is necessary.
Participants should come with an open mind. All other materials will be provided.
Wear comfortable, light color cotton / linen clothing as absorbing the vibrations is easier.
Registration: Spaces are limited, so early registration is encouraged.
performer:
Ayuushi, 
Khusbu Goyal, 
Priyanka Sinha, 
Shilpi,

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.
